note: New gen hybrid. Legendary aftermarket. Best resale.
Same platform as TRD Pro, more comfort-oriented, cheaper.
Sweet spot 4Runner. Crawl control & multi-terrain without TRD Pro price.
Base 4Runner. Still hybrid, still capable. Huge value.
Factory overlanding trim. ARB bumper, snorkel-ready, Old Man Emu suspension.
Proven platform. KDSS or TRD Pro suspension. V6 is bulletproof. Huge aftermarket.
Sweet spot 5th gen. Rear locker, crawl control. Easy to find under $35k.
Budget overland. Part-time 4WD, no rear locker, but dirt cheap and reliable.
Luxury 4Runner. E-locker, crawl control. Best interior of the Toyotas.
Less off-road gear than Overtrail but even more luxurious.
Luxury Prado. V8, full-time 4WD, Torsen center diff. Rock-solid reliability.
Budget overlander legend. V8, body-on-frame. Old but simple and reliable.
Heritage nameplate reborn. Shares platform with GX. Hybrid.
Legendary full-size. V8, full-time 4WD, KDSS. Holds value like gold.
Peak Land Cruiser for many. Solid front axle (early) or IFS. Simpler electronics.
Cult classic. Solid axles front/rear, triple-lockable. Prices rising fast.
Luxury Land Cruiser 200. Same drivetrain, nicer interior. Better value than LC200.
Full-size Toyota hybrid. Massive cargo with 3rd row folded.
Same big body, more comfort trim, less trail gear.
Affordable full-size Toyota. V8, massive cargo. Not trail-focused but capable.
Ultimate Toyota luxury. V8 twin-turbo, incredible build quality.
Hybrid LX. Twin-turbo V6 + motor, 457 hp, better MPG. Less cargo due to battery.
First Lexus with triple lockers since '97. 33" Toyo tires, crawl control, adjustable air suspension.
Retro icon. Short wheelbase, rear locker, A-TRAC. Cult following, rising prices.
Best off-road tech. Air suspension, wade sensing. Reliability is the catch.
Same bones as V8, less power but more affordable. Still has air suspension.
8-seat Defender. More cargo, slightly less agile off-road.
The original. Solid axles, simple mechanicals. Agricultural but legendary.
Capable and affordable. Air suspension, Terrain Response. Known issues but fixable.
Modern Discovery. Lost some character but gained refinement. Still very capable.
Sporty luxury. Air suspension, good capability but road-focused.
Ultimate luxury SUV. V8 twin-turbo, waftability supreme.
PHEV with 25-mi EV range. Summit trim is genuinely luxurious.
Same PHEV, less luxury trim, better value.
Off-road focused GC. Skid plates, Selec-Speed Control, extra clearance.
Best value Grand Cherokee. Air suspension on Overland+. Hemi V8 available.
Off-road WK2. Quadra-Lift air suspension, electronic limited-slip.
Massive. 67 cu ft cargo. American luxury. No gear Tetris.
Full-blown luxury. McIntosh audio, quilted leather, massive space.
Icon. Dana 44 axles, lockers, disconnecting sway bar. 4xe adds torque.
Current gen non-hybrid. 3.6 V6 or 2.0T. Dana 44s, lockers, sway bar disconnect.
Proven workhorse. Huge aftermarket. 3.6 V6 (2012+) or 3.8 V6 (earlier).
Last of the simple Wranglers. 4.0 I6 is bulletproof. Coil spring suspension.
Sasquatch pkg: 35" tires, lockers, Dana axles. Best bang/buck off-road.
More street-friendly Bronco. Still capable, nicer interior.
Desert runner. 418 hp twin-turbo, FOX Live Valve shocks, 37" tires.
Same modern Bronco, slightly cheaper used. Early production had some issues.
Off-road Expedition. Big cargo, high clearance, trail turn assist.
Aluminum body, lost weight over 3rd gen. Independent rear suspension.
Largest SUV ever made. 7.3 diesel is legendary. Cabin fits everything.
Classic full-size SUV. Huge cargo. Magnetic ride control.
Current body style. Independent rear suspension, way more cargo than previous.
Solid live axle rear. Less cargo but proven platform. Good value.
Premium Tahoe with off-road gear. Air suspension available.
682 hp supercharged V8. Ultimate American luxury performance.
Highway comfort king. Air suspension handles moderate trails.
Diesel PHEV. Extraordinary range. Less off-road but max efficiency.
S-Class of SUVs. E-Active Body Control, incredible luxury.
Icon. Three locking diffs, solid axles. Small cargo but ultimate capability.
577 hp hand-built V8. Performance G-Wagon. Statement vehicle.
Classic G-Wagen. Solid axles, 3 lockers. Pre-facelift models more affordable.
30+ mi EV range. Best highway manners. Moderate trails only.
Massive BMW luxury. 3rd row, huge presence, highway queen.
738 hp PHEV performance SUV. Controversial styling, extreme capability.
Sports car handling in SUV form. Surprisingly capable off-road with air suspension.
470 hp PHEV. 25+ mi EV range. Best driving dynamics in class.
729 hp. Fastest SUV around a track. PHEV efficiency when you want it.
Sportier roofline, less cargo. Style over practicality.
Coupe-style luxury SUV. Quattro AWD, air suspension available.
500 hp V8. Performance-focused Q8 with sport exhaust.
591 hp. Fastest SUV around Nurburgring. Ridiculous performance.
Best EV for off-road. Quad motors, 14.9" clearance, air suspension. 260+ mi range.
Range-focused R1S. 400+ mi range. Dual motor but still very capable.
Extreme capability. CrabWalk, Extract Mode, 16" clearance. Heavy but unstoppable.
Polarizing but capable. Huge bed, 11K tow. Trail mode via OTA. 300+ mi range.
Tri-motor Cybertruck. 845 hp, faster but shorter range. Same massive utility.
Falcon wing doors, huge glass roof. Road-focused but EV torque helps.
Luxury EV SUV. 300+ mi range. Incredible interior. Light trails only.
Ultimate luxury EV. Hyperscreen, 300+ mi range. Pavement-focused.
Electric G-Wagen. Tank turn capability, quad motors. Ultimate off-road EV.
Budget PHEV with S-AWC. Surprisingly capable. Low towing.
Budget overlander. Body-on-frame, solid rear axle. Extremely affordable.
Underrated full-size. Super Select 4WD, locking center diff. Great value.
Scandinavian luxury PHEV. Best safety tech, beautiful interior.
New flagship EV. 300+ mi range, stunning design, Lidar standard.
Korean luxury bargain. Excellent value, great warranty, refined ride.
Budget trail rig. Body-on-frame, 4.0 V6. Off-road capable and cheap.
Last body-on-frame Pathfinder. V6 or V8. Cheap and capable.
Global overlanding legend. Solid axles, extremely tough. Import only in US.
Ultimate road trip vehicle. Massive cargo, solid towing, surprisingly capable.
Thirsty but capable. Huge presence, solid axles. Cheap now.
Forgotten gem. TOD system, solid rear axle. Incredibly cheap.
Street-focused 4Runner. Sport-tuned suspension, same hybrid drivetrain.
American ultra-luxury. Revel audio, 30-way seats, massive presence.
Gorgeous American luxury. Air glide suspension, Revel audio system.
Redesigned flagship. HBMC suspension, twin-turbo V6, more refined.
Performance luxury SUV. SH-AWD torque vectoring, sport-tuned. Great value.
Best-value three-row. X-Pro adds off-road capability. Nappa leather available.
Telluride sibling. Excellent value luxury, great warranty.
Off-road Honda. TrailWatch cameras, steel skid plates, HPD tuned suspension.
Two-row adventure SUV. Similar TrailSport gear as Pilot, more cargo.
Upmarket Mazda. Premium feel, PHEV efficiency, excellent handling.
Redesigned with boxy look. XRT adds off-road styling, huge cargo.
Lifted Outback. X-Mode dual-function, all-terrain tires. Best Subaru for trails.
Compact trail-rated Subaru. X-Mode, all-terrain tires, lifted.
Top-trim PHEV. 30+ mi EV range, Nappa leather, great value.
Wrangler truck. Dana 44s, front/rear lockers, sway bar disconnect. Unique.
Street-focused Wrangler. More comfort, still capable. No lockers standard.
New gen hybrid truck. i-Force MAX, rear locker, Multi-Terrain Select.
New Lexus three-row PHEV. 37-mi EV range, luxurious cabin.
Sport luxury compact. HTRAC AWD, stunning value vs German competitors.
American icon. 38-inch OLED display, Super Cruise, magnetic ride.
Short wheelbase icon. Same capability as 110, more agile. Air suspension.
Three-row Grand Cherokee. Quadra-Lift air suspension, family hauler.
Launch edition with JBL audio, HUD, rock rails. 2024 only.
Luxury full-size with V8. All-Mode 4WD with low range. Great value used.
Desert runner icon. 450hp EcoBoost, FOX shocks, Trail Control. High-speed off-road beast.
Off-road capable work truck. V8 or EcoBoost, locking rear, 33" tires. Great towing.
i-Force MAX hybrid. Crawl control, rear locker, FOX shocks. Toyota reliability in a full-size.
Luxury Tundra. Premium leather, wood trim, JBL audio. Ranch-ready elegance.
Full-size off-road king. Front/rear e-lockers, 11.2" clearance, Multimatic DSSV shocks.
Mid-size off-road champ. Front/rear lockers, Multimatic shocks, Desert Boss available.
702hp Hellcat monster. Bilstein shocks, 11.8" clearance. Discontinued 2024.
Off-road style with work capability. HEMI V8, Bilstein shocks, best-in-class towing.
Baby Raptor arrives in USA. 405hp twin-turbo V6, FOX shocks, desert capability.
Smallest Trail Rated Jeep. Italian-built, affordable entry to off-road.
Trail Rated compact. Selec-Terrain, Rock mode, 4WD Lock for light trails.
TRD suspension, Multi-Terrain Select. Toyota reliability in a crossover.
9.3" clearance, X-Mode. Rugged off-road styling with Subaru AWD.
Baby Bronco. Twin-clutch rear diff, G.O.A.T. modes, Trail Control.
Upscale adventure crossover. Turbo power, Mi-Drive modes, premium interior.
Rugged styling package with HTRAC AWD. Good value, great warranty.
Adventure-ready Sportage. Center diff lock, skid plates, terrain modes.
Legendary lightweight crawler. Simple, reliable, massive aftermarket support.
Compact trail rig. Available soft-top, solid axle, low-range 4WD.
Rebadged Sidekick. Same capability, GM parts availability. Cult favorite.
More refined than Sidekick. 4WD Lock mode, reasonable towing for its size.
V6 option with real towing capability. Underrated budget overlander.
Compact 2-door SUV. Rare but capable, shares drivetrain with Rodeo.
Best-selling hybrid SUV. AWD standard, excellent fuel economy, Toyota reliability.
3-row hybrid SUV. AWD standard, 35 MPG combined, comfortable family hauler.
Hybrid-only crossover. AWD standard, sleek styling. Discontinued after 2024.
Practical hybrid crossover. Excellent interior space, Honda reliability.
Stylish hybrid crossover. HTRAC AWD, excellent warranty, modern tech.
Boxy redesign with hybrid efficiency. Huge cargo, optional 3rd row.
Value-packed hybrid. Near-40 MPG, AWD standard, great warranty.
3-row hybrid. Premium interior, efficient powertrain, great value.
Best-in-class MPG for compact SUVs. AWD available, affordable entry hybrid.
Luxury compact hybrid. Lexus refinement, excellent fuel economy.
Midsize luxury hybrid. Smooth ride, premium interior, capable towing.
PHEV with 32mi EV range. AWD standard. Less cargo than gas Tucson due to battery.
34mi EV range. AWD standard. X-Line adds rugged styling. Best PHEV MPGe in class.
Class-leading 101 MPGe. Lowest price PHEV compact. Ground clearance limits trail use.
Luxury PHEV. 37mi EV range. 302hp for spirited driving. Lexus reliability.
Flagship midsize PHEV. 37mi EV range. 3,500lb tow. Ultimate luxury and efficiency.
Legendary overlander. 4.5L I6 gas. Triple-locked with factory lockers available. Bulletproof reliability.
4.7L V8. Big performance jump from 80 Series. Center locker standard, adds comfort/tech. US had UZJ100.
Cult classic unibody 4x4. 4.0L I6 is legendary. Light weight, simple mechanics. Huge aftermarket.
4.7L V8 with VVT-i (2005+). 7K lb towing. X-REAS suspension on Sport. Last 4Runner with V8.
4.4L V8. Terrain Response. Air suspension with adjustable ride height. Capable when working. Reliability concerns.
5.8L V8. Last of the classic Broncos. Collector value rising. Two-door full-size 4x4.
2.0L turbo four. 5K lb towing. Coupe-like roofline. 5-seater variant of Atlas. 4MOTION AWD available.
2.0L turbo mild hybrid. Raised wagon with 8.1" clearance. Swedish luxury with off-road styling.
2.0L turbo+supercharged mild hybrid. 295 hp. Full-size wagon with raised suspension. Scandinavian luxury.
2.7L turbo I4 with 310 hp. 10.7" ground clearance. Multimatic DSSV dampers. Front/rear e-lockers.
6.2L V8 with 420 hp. 11.1" ground clearance. Multimatic DSSV dampers. Front/rear e-lockers. 2" factory lift.
3.0L EcoDiesel V6. 480 lb-ft torque. Best-in-class diesel mpg. Gen 3 engine much improved.
3.0L Duramax I6 turbo-diesel. 495 lb-ft torque. Best diesel towing in class.
3.0L EcoDiesel V6. 442 lb-ft torque. Discontinued 2023. Only diesel Gladiator made.
3.0L Power Stroke V6 diesel. 440 lb-ft torque. Discontinued after 2021 for hybrids/EVs.
Electric F-150. 580hp extended range. 14.1 cu ft frunk. 300+ mile range.
Full hybrid F-150. 700+ mile range, Pro Power Onboard. Best towing in class.
Electric Silverado. 492mi range with Max battery. Best EV truck range. Ultium platform.
1,000hp electric supertruck. CrabWalk, Extract Mode (+6" lift). Ultimate EV capability.
Fastest RAV4. 42mi EV range, 302hp combined. AWD standard. Toyota reliability.
Adventure EV truck. Gear tunnel, 11.1 cu ft frunk. Quad motor available (1,025hp).
3-row luxury hybrid. 366hp, sporty F Sport handling. Toyota reliability.
3-row electric SUV. 304mi range, 800V charging. Spacious interior.
PHEV Wrangler for daily driving. 21mi EV range, 375hp. More comfort than Rubicon.
Rugged body-on-frame SUV. 4.0L V6. Electronic locking rear diff. Great value overlander.
Solid axle budget overlander. 3.5L V6. Watch for transmission issues at high miles.
Short wheelbase crawler. Dana 44s, front/rear lockers, sway bar disconnect. Ultimate trail rig.
Classic modern Wrangler. Dana 44s, e-lockers front/rear. 3.6L Pentastar V6 from 2012+.
Last simple Wrangler. Legendary 4.0L I6. Coil spring upgrade from YJ. Dana 44s on Rubicon.
Short wheelbase trail machine. 2.7L EcoBoost. Bilstein dampers, front locker. Sasquatch available.
Compact unibody truck. 2.0L EcoBoost. Trail-tuned AWD. Great daily driver with mild trail capability.
Crossover-based sport adventure truck. 2.5L NA. Car-like ride, versatile bed with lockable tonneau.
Traditional mid-size truck. 3.8L V6. Electronic locking rear diff. Strong towing capacity.
Mid-size overlanding staple. 2.4T i-FORCE. Massive aftermarket support. Best resale in class.
Mid-size value truck. 2.7L EcoBoost V6. Strong towing for class. New global platform.
3-row family SUV. 2.4L turbo boxer. Symmetrical AWD standard. StarTex water-repellent upholstery.
Premium 2-row CUV. 2.5L turbo PHEV (323hp combined). Near-luxury interior. 26mi EV range.
Compact 3-row CUV. 2.0T. Refined ride quality. German engineering with practical space.
Premium compact CUV. 2.0T (272hp). SH-AWD torque vectoring. ELS Studio 3D audio.
Modern body-on-frame utility SUV. BMW 3.0L I6 turbo. 3 locking diffs. Built as Defender successor.
America's best-selling vehicle. Volume trim, 2.7L EcoBoost. Part-time 4WD with low range.
Volume mid-size truck. 2.4T i-Force, part-time 4WD. New gen on TNGA-F platform.
Volume full-size with Z71 off-road package. 5.3L V8, 2" factory lift, auto-locking rear diff.
Best-selling Ram trim. 5.7L HEMI V8 with eTorque mild hybrid. Class-leading ride quality.
Best-selling non-truck in the US. Gas 1.5T, Real-Time AWD. Practical and reliable.
Subcompact CUV. 2.0L NA, Real-Time AWD. Budget Honda entry point.
Unibody mid-size truck. 3.5L V6, i-VTM4 AWD. In-bed trunk, dual-action tailgate.
All-new 3rd gen on PPC platform. 2.0T mild hybrid, Quattro AWD. Premium interior.
3-row luxury SUV. 3.0T V6, Quattro AWD. Strong towing for the class.
Discontinued 2024 (Brussels factory closed). 402hp tri-motor, 285mi range. Renamed from e-tron in 2023.
Lifted luxury wagon. 3.0T V6, air suspension standard. No US tow rating. Fills wagon gap.
Gas base CUV. 2.5L boxer, Symmetrical AWD. X-MODE standard. Budget trail-capable.
3-row mid-size SUV. 2.0T, 4MOTION AWD. Huge cargo. VW volume family hauler.
Hemi V8 3-row muscle SUV. Select-Trac II with low range.
Off-road trim Explorer. Raised suspension, all-terrain tires, Torsen LSD rear. Discontinued 2025.
Redesigned Patrol-based full-size. 3.5L twin-turbo V6, air suspension, 8 seats.
Top-selling compact CUV. VC-Turbo 3-cyl, Intelligent AWD.
Redesigned compact CUV. Sporty RS styling, panoramic roof, 11.3" touchscreen.
Premium compact CUV. Turbo power, Bose audio, HUD. Final year of 2nd gen.
Redesigned compact luxury CUV. 48V mild hybrid, xDrive AWD, 14.9" curved display.
